title: Grammar and Sentence Structure

vocab.definition: A word that names a person, place, thing, or idea
A specific name that starts with a capital letter
A word that shows action or being
A word that describes a noun
A group of words that has a subject and verb and expresses a complete thought
A punctuation mark (,) used to separate parts of a sentence
A punctuation mark (') used in contractions and possessives
Punctuation marks (" ") used around spoken words

teachingNotes: Use interactive games to identify parts of speech. Practice building sentences from simple to complex. Use colorful sentence strips.

sample.question: What part of speech is the word 'run' in the sentence 'I run fast'?

truefalse.question: Every complete sentence must have a noun and a verb.
expectedAny: sentences need both a subject (noun) and predicate (verb)

multiplechoice.question: Which word is an adjective in this sentence: 'The big dog ran quickly'?

fillintheblank.question: In the sentence 'The cat sleeps,' the word 'cat' is a _____ and 'sleeps' is a _____.

shortanswer.question: How can you tell if a group of words is a complete sentence?
